attributes.action: Give social care workers a pay rise following Coronavirus efforts
attributes.additional_details: Those with a variety of complex needs  rely on carers now more than ever. Without them, there would be even more tragedies and the NHS would become more overwhelmed than it already is. In light of this, I feel their selfless efforts need to be recognised especially as there have already been lives lost amongst social care workers  in the care sector during the Coronavirus outbreak.
attributes.background: Aside from the NHS, social care workers are selflessly putting themselves at risk to care for the most  vulnerable to Coronavirus, which also eases the strain on our NHS. Many of these carers are receiving the minimum wage. There efforts need to be recognised with a pay rise

rejection.details:
You might like to sign these petitions, which call for similar actions:

Increase the minimum wage for social care staff:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316909

Pay rise for NHS and care staff
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313488

Reward our healthcare heroes now for risking their lives to fight Covid-19.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318741

Fund increased pay for lower band nurses and care assistants
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309726
